argo_cancel_modal.description: Your zone %{zone} will be **%{decrease}%** slower if you disable Argo Smart Routing. Your zone's latency is **%{latency}ms** and will increase to **%{latencyIncrease}ms** if you disable Argo Smart Routing.

argo_enable_modal.accept_terms.descripti:
#### Argo is a usage based product.

You will be billed on the amount of data transferred between Cloudflare and your visitors. This includes cache hits and requests to the endpoint. It does not include DDoS traffic.

#### Argo Price

You will be charged a monthly fee of $5.00 per website plus $0.10 for every gigabyte of transfer from Cloudflare to your visitors.

traffic.argo.analytics.cards.performance: Improve load times, avoid traffic congestion, and reduce bandwidth usage with Argo Smart Routing. On average, web assets load 30% faster with Argo.
**Speed Tip:** Improve load times, avoid traffic congestion, and reduce bandwidth usage with Argo Smart Routing. On average, web assets load 30% faster with Argo.
traffic.argo.analytics.help.global:
Above is a histogram of Time To First Byte (TTFB). The blue and orange series represent the before and after TTFB in locations Argo found a Smart Route.

TTFB measures the delay between Cloudflare sending a request to your server and receiving the first byte in response. TTFB includes network transit time (which Smart Routing optimizes) and processing time on your server (which Argo has no effect on).
traffic.argo.analytics.help.geographical:
Each circle on the map above represents a Cloudflare network location. The larger the circle, the more traffic was served out of that location. The colors represent the improvement in Time to First Byte (TTFB) Argo delivered in that location.

TTFB measures the delay between Cloudflare sending a request to your server and receiving the first byte in response. TTFB includes network transit time (which Smart Routing optimizes) and processing time on your server (which Argo has no effect on).

traffic.argo.page.description: Detects real-time network issues and routes traffic across the most efficient network path.
traffic.argo.card.description:
Argo is a service that uses optimized routes across the Cloudflare network to **deliver responses to your users more quickly, reliably, and securely.**

Enabling Argo activates Argo Smart Routing, reducing Internet latency on average by more than 30% and connection errors by 27%.

This feature is a usage-based product. Learn more about how [billing](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/115000224192) works for Argo.
traffic.argo.card.description_with_prici:
Argo is a service that uses optimized routes across the Cloudflare network to **decrease loading times, increase reliability, and reduce bandwidth costs.**

Enabling Argo activates Argo Smart Routing, reducing Internet latency by 30% and connection errors by 27% on average.

Argo is a usage-based product and costs USD $5.00 per month, plus usage. After exceeding the first gigabyte of traffic between Cloudflare and your visitors, you are charged USD $0.10 per additional gigabyte.

Below is estimated pricing based on the expected amount of traffic:
traffic.argo.card.description.ent:
Argo is a service that uses optimized routes across the Cloudflare network to **deliver responses to your users more quickly, reliably, and securely.**

Enabling Argo activates Argo Smart Routing, reducing Internet latency on average by more than 30% and connection errors by 27%.
traffic.argo.card.help:
All three functionalities listed below are available upon enabling Argo. Youu2019ll need to start by enabling Smart Routing above to gain access to Tiered Caching and Tunnel.

**Smart Routing**

Argo's smart routing algorithm uses real-time network intelligence to route traffic through the fastest Cloudflare network paths, while maintaining open, secure connections to eliminate latency imposed by connection setup.

To enable Argo Smart Routing and gain access to the Argo functionalities listed below, select the enable slider above. Please refer to the [Argo Smart Routing knowledge base article](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/115000224552) for more information.

**Tiered Caching**

Argou2019s tiered caching technology uses regional tier 1 Cloudflare data centers to propagate content to Cloudflareu2019s global network, minimizing static content requests to your server, while reducing bandwidth and total costs.

**Tunnel**

Using a lightweight daemon installed on the origin infrastructure, including containers or virtual machines, Cloudflare Tunnel creates an encrypted tunnel between the nearest Cloudflare data center and an applicationu2019s origin server, without opening a public inbound port.

To get started with Cloudflare Tunnel, please refer to the [Cloudflare Tunnel quickstart documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cloudflare-one/connections/connect-apps/install-and-setup/).

**Pricing**

This feature is a usage-based product and costs USD $5.00 per month. After exceeding the first gigabyte of traffic between Cloudflare and your visitors, you are charged USD $0.10 per additional gigabyte.
traffic.argo.card.help_with_pricing_link:
Both functionalities listed below are available upon enabling Argo. Youu2019ll need to start by enabling Argo above to gain access to Smart Routing and Tunnel.

**Smart Routing**

Argo's smart routing algorithm uses real-time network intelligence to route traffic through the fastest Cloudflare network paths, while maintaining open, secure connections to eliminate latency imposed by connection setup.

To enable Argo Smart Routing and gain access to the Argo functionalities listed below, select the enable slider above. Please refer to the [Argo Smart Routing knowledge base article](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/115000224552) for more information.

**Tunnel**

Using a lightweight daemon installed on the origin infrastructure, including containers or virtual machines, Cloudflare Tunnel creates an encrypted tunnel between the nearest Cloudflare data center and an applicationu2019s origin server, without opening a public inbound port.

To get started with Cloudflare Tunnel, please refer to the [Cloudflare Tunnel quickstart documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cloudflare-one/connections/connect-apps/install-and-setup/).

**Pricing**

This feature is a usage-based product and costs USD $5.00 per month. After exceeding the first gigabyte of traffic between Cloudflare and your visitors, you are charged USD $0.10 per additional gigabyte. Learn more about how [billing](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/115000224192) works for Argo.
traffic.argo.card.help.ent:
Both Argo functionalities listed below are included within your Argo subscription. Youu2019ll need to contact your Account Manager to enable an Argo subscription.

**Smart Routing**

Argo's smart routing algorithm uses real-time network intelligence to route traffic through the fastest Cloudflare network paths, while maintaining open, secure connections to eliminate latency imposed by connection setup.

To enable Argo Smart Routing, please refer to the Argo Smart Routing [knowledge base article](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/115000224552) or contact your Cloudflare Account Manager.

**Tunnel**

Using a lightweight daemon installed on the origin infrastructure, including containers or virtual machines, Cloudflare Tunnel creates an encrypted tunnel between the nearest Cloudflare data center and an applicationu2019s origin server, without opening a public inbound port.

 To enable Cloudflare Tunnel, please contact your Account Manager to refer to the [Cloudflare Tunnel quickstart documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cloudflare-one/connections/connect-apps/install-and-setup/).

**Pricing**

Please contact your Account Manager.

traffic.argo.cache_topology_card.title: Tiered Cache Topology
traffic.argo.cache_topology_card.descrip:
Selecting your cache topology allows you to control how your origin connects to Cloudflareu2019s data centers to help ensure higher cache hit ratios, fewer origin connections, and a reduction of Internet latency.

**Smart Tiered Cache Topology** instructs Cloudflare to find the single best upper tier(s) for your origin(s).

**Generic Global Tiered Topology** instructs Cloudflare to use its representative sample of global data centers as a network of upper tiers.

**Custom Tiered Cache Topology** allows you to work with Cloudflareu2019s support team to set a custom topology that fits your specific needs. If you want a custom topology, please contact your CSM.
traffic.argo.cache_topology_card.cache_a: View cache topology analytics under the<0> Cache tab</0>.
traffic.argo.cache_topology_card.custom_: <0>Contact your CSM</0> to make changes to custom cache topology. Once set, selecting alternate topologies will require reconfiguration.
tiered_cache.help: With Smart Tiered Cache Topology, Cloudflare will identify the Cloudflare data centers closest to your origin and only allow these data centers to pull from your origin, saving you bandwidth and processing power at your origin.

Automatically send traffic to endpoints within a pool during transient network issues
**None**: no failover will take place and errors may show to your users
**Temporary**: traffic will be sent to other endpoint(s) until the originally pinned endpoint is available
**Sticky**: the session affinity cookie is updated and subsequent requests are sent to the new endpoint

traffic.health_checks.help_drawer:
Health Checks allow you to monitor your critical resources on the internet from Cloudflare's Edge. Health Checks are included in all Cloudflare paid plans.

For more guidance on using Health Checks, see [our support documentation](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/4404867308429).

The port to Health Check against.
The expected HTTP response codes listed individually (200, 302) or as a range (2xx, 3xx).
A case-insensitive sub-string to look for in the response body. If this string is not found, the endpoint will be marked as unhealthy.
The HTTP request headers to send in the health check. It is recommended you set a Host header by default. The User-Agent header cannot be overridden.
Do not validate the certificate when the monitor uses HTTPS
If enabled, the probe will follow redirects

traffic.load_balancing.delete_descriptio: Are you sure you want to delete this load balancing record?

Are you sure you want to delete this load balancing record?

There is a DNS record managed by this Load balancer. Deleting will cause the associated DNS record to be removed and may result in resolution errors for `%{hostname}`.
If you would like resolution for this hostname `%{hostname}` to continue, <0>please add a separate DNS record in the DNS section</0> of the dashboard before deleting the load balancer.

Additionally, deleting the Load Balancer may have an impact on other products such as, but not limited to, Worker routes, Spectrum, etc, that are dependent on the Load Balancing hostname.

Are you sure you want to delete this load balancing record?

There is a DNS record managed by this Load balancer. Deleting will cause the associated DNS record to be removed. We have checked your additional DNS records and see another record entry exists with the same hostname, `%{hostname}`. To ensure resolution continues properly, <0>please check this entry is setup properly</0> to avoid any possible service disruption.

Additionally, deleting the Load Balancer may have an impact on other products such as, but not limited to, Worker routes, Spectrum, etc, that are dependent on a valid DNS record for the corresponding hostname.

If you would like resolution for this hostname `%{hostname}` to continue, <0>please add a separate DNS record in the DNS section</0> of the dashboard before disabling the load balancer.

Additionally, disabling the Load Balancer may have an impact on other products such as, but not limited to, Worker routes, Spectrum, etc, that are dependent on the Load Balancing hostname.

Are you sure you want to disable this load balancer?

There is a DNS record managed by this Load balancer. Disabling will cause the associated DNS record to be removed. We have checked your additional DNS records and see another record entry exists with the same hostname, `%{hostname}`. To ensure resolution continues properly, please check this entry is setup properly to avoid any possible service disruption.

Additionally, disabling the Load Balancer may have an impact on other products such as, but not limited to, Worker routes, Spectrum, etc, that are dependent on a valid DNS record for the corresponding hostname.

traffic.load_balancing.health_check.titl: Attach a Monitor to an Endpoint
traffic.load_balancing.help:
#### Load Balancing 
 Cloud-based load balancing eliminates the need for dedicated hardware or software solutions, reducing the impact of local network failures on your global availability, while offering a cost-effective solution that scales with your growing user base. For more help setting up a load balancer, refer to [our documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/load-balancing/get-started).
traffic.load_balancing.hostname.descript: This public facing DNS hostname will replace any existing record with the same name. The default hostname is the root hostname.
traffic.load_balancing.data_localization: Data Localization helps customers who want to maintain local control over their traffic while retaining the security benefits of a global network. To learn more visit our [documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/data-localization/).
Edit permissions required. Please contact your super admin.
traffic.load_balancing.hostname.title: Hostname
traffic.load_balancing.interval.label: Interval
traffic.load_balancing.interval.tooltip: The interval between each health check. Shorter intervals may improve failover time, but will increase load on the endpoints as we check from multiple locations.
traffic.load_balancing.method.label: Method
traffic.load_balancing.method.tooltip: The HTTP method to use for the health check.
(Set the timeout, expected codes, match on the response body and configure header)
traffic.load_balancing.monitor.descripti: Monitors actively probe the health of each of your endpoint servers from Cloudflare's data centers. An endpoint will be marked as 'unhealthy' when it fails to match the required settings below - e.g. returning 404 'Not Found' instead of a 200 'OK'.
traffic.load_balancing.monitor.modal.sub: Manage Monitors in all Load Balancers
traffic.load_balancing.endpoint.name: Endpoint Name
Required when configuring an endpoint behind a tunnel or within a virtual network. To learn more visit our <0>documentation</0>
traffic.load_balancing.endpoint.weight.i:
The weight (0.01 - 1.00) of this endpoint is relative to other endpoints in the pool. Equal values mean equal weighting. A weight of 0 means traffic will not be sent to this endpoint, but health is still checked. Calculated percentages below are applicable when all endpoints are healthy.

Grey-clouded Load Balancers support weights. DNS resolvers, however, may cache resolved IPs for clients, resulting in different weighting than specified.

traffic.load_balancing.pool.load_sheddin: Shedding controls for traffic without <0>Session Affinity</0> sessions.
Use load shedding to help avoid overload on a pool by redirecting a percentage of traffic onto other pools in connected Load Balancers.
The random policy randomly selects requests to shed to reach desired shed %. Consecutive requests may arbitrarily hit different pools.
IP hash policy bases shed % on source IP and destination pool. Improves chance of requests landing on a consistent endpoint, but shed % accuracy will vary.
Shedding controls for all traffic with existing <0>Session Affinity</0> sessions.
traffic.load_balancing.pool.order.title: Order
traffic.load_balancing.pool.endpoint_ste: Default Weight is inherited by any pools which do not have their weight individually specified
If the Endpoint Steering is Least Outstanding Requests, this endpoint weight is used to scale the endpoint's outstanding requests.

traffic.load_balancing.pool.threshold.to: The number of endpoints required to be up in order for the pool to be considered healthy.

traffic.load_balancing.port.tooltip: The port to health check against.
traffic.load_balancing.response_body.too: A case insensitive sub-string to look for in the response body. If this string is not found, the endpoint will be marked as unhealthy.
traffic.load_balancing.retries.label: Retries
traffic.load_balancing.simulate_zone.too: Assign this monitor to simulate the specified zone while monitoring.
traffic.load_balancing.retries.tooltip: The number of retries to attempt in case of a timeout before marking the endpoint as unhealthy. Retries are attempted immediately.
Session Affinity requires your Load Balancer to be configured as an orange cloud (proxied).
All specified HTTP headers must be present on load balancing requests to establish header-based sessions.
At least one of the specified HTTP headers must be present on load balancing requests to establish header-based sessions.

Session Affinity, sometimes referred to as sticky sessions, associates all requests coming from an end-user with a single endpoint. Cloudflare will set a cookie on the initial response to the client, such that consequent requests with the cookie in the request will go to the same endpoint, so long as it is available.
By Cloudflare cookie and Client IP fallback
If there is no cookie, the request will fall back to an IP
Time, in seconds, the user's session will be valid.
Time, in seconds, the user's session will be valid. Subsequent requests extend the session.

Turning off orange cloud (proxying) will disable any session affinity setting for this load balancer. The session affinity feature requires an orange cloud load balancer.

Are you sure you want to disable proxying?
Time, in seconds, where the endpoint will drain active sessions. Once the time elapses, all existing sessions will be ended.
Updates to the endpoint drain duration will be applied across these pools that are draining:
Updates to the endpoint drain duration will be applied across these endpoints that are draining:
Controls features that modify the routing of requests to pools and endpoints in response to dynamic conditions, such as during the interval between active health monitoring requests. If there is another healthy endpoint in the same pool, the request is retried once against this alternate endpoint.

Extends zero-downtime failover of requests to healthy endpoints from alternate pools, when no healthy alternate exists in the same pool, according to the failover order defined by traffic and endpoint steering. When set to off zero-downtime failover will only occur between endpoints within the same pool. See Session Affinity for control over when sessions are broken or reassigned.

traffic.load_balancing.upsell.title.cont: Get greater agility, visibility, and control
traffic.load_balancing.upsell.benefit.un: Reduce latency by routing visitors to the nearest or most available pool (Dynamic Steering)
Deliver personalized experience by delivering localized content (Geo Steering)
Avoid server overload by leveraging weighted traffic distribution
traffic.load_balancing.upsell.benefit.do: Actively monitor endpoint health u2014 make proactive decisions, not reactive ones
No single point of failure. Load balance at every PoP
traffic.load_balancing.upsell.benefit.co: Agility: Easy to set up. Scale without adding more metals
Visibility: Get granular insights into your traffic and endpoint health
Control: Unified control in a multi-cloud or hybrid environment
traffic.load_balancing.wizard.failover.d: Traffic is steered to default pools when a region does not have a pool assigned. Traffic is steered to pools in order of availability - e.g. traffic will always land on Pool #1 until it is marked unhealthy.

A failover policy allows you steer traffic towards your secondary pools, in the event that the primary pool is considered "unhealthy". The "health" of the pool will be determined by our health checks, as defined in the Monitor associated with the pool.
traffic.load_balancing.wizard.failover.s: Cloudflare will route traffic to the pools in these regions. Traffic is routed to pools in order of availability. Traffic outside of these regions will adhere to the previously defined failover policy

Your subscription does not currently allow you to set up a routing method. In order to configure a routing method, and route traffic to the nearest available datacenter, please modify your Load Balancing subscription. You can do so by clicking on u201CConfigure Additional Featuresu201D under Load Balancing.
**Dynamic steering:** Route traffic to the fastest pool based on measured latency from health checks.
Dynamic steering works only when you configure a health check. Please configure this in the previous step.
**Geo steering:** Route to specific pools based on the Cloudflare region serving the request.
If traffic is not proxied through the Load Balancer, the country will be determined by Location Strategy settings.
Region geosteering is not enabled for this account, traffic steering needs to be purchased to use this feature
**Proximity steering**: Route requests to the closest physical pool.
If traffic is not proxied through the Load Balancer, the closest pool will be determined by Location Strategy settings.
**Off:** Cloudflare will route pools in failover order.
**Random steering:** Route to a healthy pool at random or weighted random.
**Least outstanding requests steering:** Route traffic based on pool weights and number of pending requests.
Pools with more in-flight requests are weighted proportionately less relative to others.
**Least connections steering:** Route traffic based on pool weights and number of open connections.
Least connections steering currently supports HTTP/1 and HTTP/2 traffic
Pools can have a relative weight added to adjust how much traffic should be sent to the respective pool.
The weight (0.01 - 1.00) of this pool is relative to other pools in the load balancer. Equal values mean equal weighting. A weight of 0 means traffic will not be sent to this pool.
traffic.load_balancing.wizard.fallback.d: In the event that all pools are marked down, Cloudflare uses the fallback pool, which is the option of last resort for successfully sending traffic to an endpoint. Since the fallback pool is a last resort, its health is not taken into account, and Cloudflare reports its status as 'No Health'.
traffic.load_balancing.wizard.location_s: Controls location-based steering for non-proxied requests. See Traffic Steering to learn how steering is affected.
This setting is only for unproxied or grey clouded load balancers.
Choose whether the EDNS Client Subnet (ECS) GeoIP should be preferred as the authoritative location.
**Proximity**: Prefer ECS only when Traffic Steering is Proximity.
**Geo**: Prefer ECS only when Traffic Steering is Geo.
The selected ECS method does not pair with the selected Traffic Steering policy.
Determines the authoritative location when ECS is not preferred, does not exist in the request, or its GeoIP lookup is unsuccessful.
**PoP location**: Use the Cloudflare PoP location.
**Resolver GeoIP**: Use the DNS resolver GeoIP location. If the GeoIP lookup is unsuccessful, use the Cloudflare PoP location.
traffic.load_balancing.wizard.health_che: Attach a health check to this pool
traffic.load_balancing.wizard.pools.adde: The ordering of the pools in the load balancer determines the order in which pools in the load balancer will fail over. When the number of healthy endpoints within a pool goes below the configured threshold, Cloudflare will send traffic to the next available pool - e.g. traffic will always land on Pool #1 until it is marked unhealthy.
traffic.load_balancing.wizard.pools.desc: Pools are groups of endpoints that Cloudflare will steer traffic to. Traffic is intelligently steered based on the health of each endpoint within the pool. Pools can be attached to a simple primary-secondary failover policy, random steering, proximity steering, or associated with a specific geographic region.
traffic.load_balancing.wizard.summary.se: Session Affinity On: By Cloudflare cookie only
Session Affinity On: By Cloudflare cookie and Client IP fallback
Session Affinity On: By HTTP headers
traffic.load_balancing.wizard.summary.pr: Proxied: Traffic will go through Cloudflare
Not proxied: Traffic will not go through Cloudflare

traffic.waiting_rooms.settings.title: SEO Crawler Bypassing
traffic.waiting_rooms.settings.descripti:
Enable SEO Crawler Bypassing to ensure that trusted SEO Crawlers, verified by Bot Management, are never placed in your waiting rooms. By not being queued, SEO crawlers are always able to crawl your site, which helps maintain your SEO and search results in major search engines. By enabling this service, you understand that these verified crawlers are completely bypassing your waiting rooms. No waiting room settings or features will apply to this traffic.

For more details, see the <0>developer docs.
traffic.waiting_rooms.columns.name: Name
traffic.waiting_rooms.columns.host_and_p: Additional hostnames and paths for this waiting room:
traffic.waiting_rooms.events.inherit_tau: Always inherit (current values - Total active users: %{totalActive}; New users per minute: %{newUsersPm})
traffic.waiting_rooms.events.pre-queuing: If pre-queueing is enabled, users who visit the application between pre-queue time and event start time will be placed in a queue and let in before users who arrive at the application after event start time. Note that only new visitors will be pre-queued. If you would like to also pre-queue existing visitors, make the pre-queueing time period longer than the session duration and disable session renewal.
traffic.waiting_rooms.events.errors.dura: Must be a value between 1 and 30.
traffic.waiting_rooms.events.errors.name: Only alphanumerical characters, hypens and underscores allowed.
Name is required.
traffic.waiting_rooms.events.errors.preq: Pre-queue must happen at least 5 minutes before the event start date.
Please provide a pre-queue start time.
traffic.waiting_rooms.events.errors.star: Event start must happen before event end.
Event date range must not overlap with another event.
traffic.waiting_rooms.events.errors.user: Must be a value between 200 and 2147483647.
Must be less than Total active users
traffic.waiting_rooms.events.event_start: All users in pre-queue will be randomized at event start to ensure fairness. Mostly used together with queueing method FIFO.
traffic.waiting_rooms.events.pre_queue.d: Must be at least 5 minutes before event start time
traffic.waiting_rooms.events.used_events: You are using %{eventsCount} out of %{eventsMaxCount} events allowed per waiting room.
traffic.waiting_rooms.events.tau_nupm: Total active users and New users per minute
traffic.waiting_rooms.events.tau_nupm.de: Total active users sets the target maximum number of active users in the application. The New users per minute sets the amount of users that can be let into the application. Both values must be at least 200. New users per minute cannot exceed total active users.
traffic.waiting_rooms.events.settings_de: Your waiting room settings will be inherited by the event, unless specified otherwise below.
traffic.waiting_rooms.events.settings_to: If you choose u201CAlways inheritu201D your event settings are subject to changes made at the waiting room level. To ensure a stable setting input your own value or choose the override function.
traffic.waiting_rooms.events.enabled.too: When off, the event will be ignored and traffic will be handled based on the waiting room's normal configuration.
traffic.waiting_rooms.events.max_users: The target maximum number of active users in the application
traffic.waiting_rooms.fields.max_inactiv: The maximum amount of inactive time the users' session will be valid for an endpoint, in minutes
traffic.waiting_rooms.events.session_not: Checking this setting will result in end-user sessions to not be renewed
traffic.waiting_rooms.events.landing_pag: Use the existing waiting room's template or customize one specifically for this event
traffic.waiting_rooms.force_queue.activa: This will override your defined limits and send all traffic to the Waiting Room.
traffic.waiting_rooms.force_queue.deacti: This will reroute traffic according to your defined limits.

traffic.waiting_rooms.fields.queueing_me: Method used when queueing end-users within the waiting room
First-In-First-Out queue where customers gain access in the order they arrived.
Allow all traffic to pass directly through your waiting room and into your application.
Prevent any traffic from reaching your application. Users will see a static page.
Random queue where customers gain access randomly, regardless of arrival time.
Upgrade to the full Enterprise version of Waiting Room to use additional queueing methods.
traffic.waiting_rooms.upsell.description: Stay online, provide an excellent customer experience, and protect your application during traffic surges.
Ensure that your online transactions are not impacted by downtime or slow application performance during peak traffic hours.
Waiting room acts as an extension of your brand, ensuring that users get a seamless online experience even while waiting.
Eliminate costs associated with maintaining additional servers and purchasing extra bandwidth to serve peak traffic.
traffic.waiting_rooms.wizard.steps.setti: Set target thresholds for your waiting room and choose a queueing method.  Queuing will trigger as either total active user or new users per minute setting is approached.
These setting will determine how long a user can retain their spot on your site once past the waiting room.
Allow session termination via origin commands

Checking this setting will allow your waiting room to accept an origin command to end a user's session before session duration timeout.  You must configure origin commands on your site to use this feature. <0>Learn more</0>.
traffic.waiting_rooms.wizard.customizati: Select the preview state for your waiting room
traffic.waiting_rooms.bypass_rules.previ: You currently have no waiting room bypass rules active for this waiting room.
You currently have %{smart_count} bypass rule active for this waiting room. |||| You currently have %{smart_count} bypass rules active for this waiting room.

Please be advised that the waiting room will not apply to all traffic that matches the expressions written for bypass rules and will not be counted as active users. No Waiting Room features, including but not limited to, Event pre-queueing, Reject queueing method, or Queue-all will apply to this traffic.
